1.text: Sprinkle flour on your work surface and rolling pin to prevent sticking.

2.text: Cut your dough into 4 portions so it’s easier to roll out.
2.vid: /a/a3/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Roll each portion into a ball.
3.vid: /b/b2/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Place 1 ball on your work surface to roll it out.

5.text: Press your rolling pin into the dough and roll away from your body.
5.vid: /6/6b/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 5.360p.mp4

6.text: Turn the dough 90 degrees after each pass with the rolling pin.
6.vid: /f/fb/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 6.360p.mp4

7.text: Flatten the dough until it’s about 1⁄16 in (0.16 cm) thick.
7.vid: /c/ce/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 7.360p.mp4

8.text: Use a knife to trim the dough into a rectangle.
8.vid: /4/47/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 8.360p.mp4

9.text: Let your dough dry for 20 minutes.

10.text: Sprinkle the dough with flour so it doesn’t stick to itself.
10.vid: /e/e6/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 10.360p.mp4

11.text: Fold up the dough lengthwise before you cut it into pieces.
11.vid: /3/33/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 11.360p.mp4

12.text: Slice the folded dough into pieces using a knife.
12.vid: /7/7f/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 12.360p.mp4

13.text: Unroll the pasta, flour it, and let it dry for 15 minutes before cooking it.
13.vid: /0/0b/Roll Out Pasta Dough by Hand Step 13.360p.mp4

14.text: Dry your pasta for 3 to 4 hours if you want to store it.

15.text: Store the pasta at room temperature in an airtight container for later use.
